frameDefinitions: A physical entity, construed as a point-Sound_source, emits a Sound.
A Helper benefits a Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a Goal that the Benefited_party has.
An Offerer indicates that he or she is able and willing to give a Theme to a Potential_recipient.
In this frame, a Resource_controller is judged by a Judge (who is usually implicit)  according to how freely they allow the Recipient access to their Resource.
A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
The words of this frame describe how a Resource_controller spends money or other Resources for a particular purpose .
frameExamples: Will you <t>help</t> the Government find your brother?
The host graciously <t>offered</t> us food and drink.
listRoleDefinitions: The frame element <fen>Sound_source</fen> is assigned to a constituent referring to a physical entity which emits a sound. Such an entity must have an appropriately complex internal structure such that it can create a sound. For example, a machine or some other thing with moving parts can create sound by itself.

The frame element <fen>Sound</fen> is incorporated in the meaning of the verbs of this frame. Otherwise, this role is assigned to NPs which actually refer to a sound in the presence of the target. This typically occurs when the target is a verb used as a modifier in its <ment>-ing</ment> form, e.g.:
An event in which one or more <fen>Sound_source</fen>s participate and which is accompanied by <fen>Sound</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Noisy_event</fen> occurs.

The location of the <fen>Sound_source</fen>. This role differs from <fen>Location_of_source</fen> only in terms of point of view; the latter role implies a point of view that is not on the <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
The <fen>Benefited_party</fen> receives a benefit from the action of the <fen>Helper</fen>.
The <fen>Helper</fen> performs some action that benefits the <fen>Benefited_party</fen>.
The desirable state of affairs that the <fen>Benefited_party</fen> is involved in and which is enabled by the <fen>Helper</fen>.
This role identifies a <fen>Focal_entity</fen> involved in achieving the <fen>Goal</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Assistance occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Assistance occurs.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and offers it to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object which is offered for transfer.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
The Resource_Controller is the individual who controls access to the Resource.
The Resource_controller controls the Recipient's access to the Resource.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> is the individual or individuals who receive or should receive the <fen>Resource</fen> from the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The Behavior is an action of the Resource_controller which is judged to be generous or stingy.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.

The <fen>Resource_controller</fen> is the individual whose frugality or generosity is being described. Person typically occurs as the External Argument or, in some cases when <fen>Behavior</fen> is also expressed, in an <ment>of</ment>-PP:
Some specific <fen>Behavior</fen> may be described as frugal or extravagant, rather than attributing the characteristic directly to the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
This role is the resource which the <fen>Resource_controller</fen> expends.
listRoleExamples: It's going to beep again <fex>in two minutes</fex>.
Whoever didn't cook has to help <fex>with the dishes</fex>.
The police assisted Harry in finding his cat <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police assisted Harry in finding his cat <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
Surprising, Dad was stingy <fex>with his inheritance</fex>.
Mr. Burns is extremely miserly <fex>towards his employees</fex>.
It was generous of Jim <fex>to have us over for dinner</fex>.
It's thrifty of Jo <fex>to re-use teabags</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Essay on the Principle of Population (1798
